event: Earliest Maya settlements appear in what is now Belize.
Start of the Classic Maya period; major cities like Caracol and Lamanai flourish.
Collapse of many major Maya cities in the region.
Christopher Columbus sails near the coast of Belize on his fourth voyage.
British buccaneers begin to settle in Belize, logging mahogany and other hardwoods.
Treaty of Paris grants British rights to log in the area, though Spain retains sovereignty.
Battle of St. George's Caye – British settlers and slaves repel Spanish attack.
Belize formally declared a British Crown Colony, named British Honduras.
Hurricane devastates Belize City; poor response sparks labor activism.
Name changed from British Honduras to Belize.
Belize gains full independence from the United Kingdom on September 21.
Belize joins the Caribbean Court of Justice.
Economic crisis and unrest over government tax reforms and spending.
Government seeks public support for taking Belize–Guatemala territorial dispute to the ICJ.
Referendum held; majority support taking Guatemala dispute to International Court of Justice.
Belize deals with economic fallout from COVID-19 and tourism collapse.
